item.title: Best Way to Manage Your Phone System: Get Rid of It
item.description: By: John Shepler What do all businesses have in common? Telephones. And what’s a common need for all business phone systems? Management. But imagine if you could eliminate that burden â€“ wouldn’t that be fantastic and give your business a competitive edge? It certainly could. Let’s explore why, and more importantly, how. The Problem with Traditional Phone Systems The traditional business phone is a bulky piece of equipment, filled with analog technology and tethered to the phone company with its own dedicated line.

item.title: You Pay Too Much For Your Business Phone
item.description: The telephone industry has undergone significant changes, even if you haven’t updated your phone system in a while. Sticking with outdated technology could mean you’re overpaying and missing out on valuable features. What has changed? While phones might seem simple, their technology has evolved. In the past, all phones were standardized because they came from a single provider, the local telephone company. These phones were basic devices connected to a central switching system.
